intro: Scrophularia decumbens, commonly known as the prostrate figwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 5–20 cm, with a sprawling, decumbent habit. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are tubular, usually pink to purple, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
